title: Designing and Implementing Monitoring and Evaluating Systems
headline: Learn how to design and implement effective monitoring and evaluation (M&E) systems with this free online course.
description: This free online M&E systems design course will teach you about how you can transform program-results frameworks and indicators into a well-functioning system of data collection, analysis, interpretation, reporting, and learning. You will also learn how to apply the theories of generic concepts of RBM and M&E systems in practical ways. Learn about designing, implementing, monitoring, and evaluating systems with this free course
courseDescription:
Monitoring demonstrates results and informs decision making while evaluation assesses what results have been achieved and how they have been achieved. This course will first discuss the main differences between monitoring and evaluation. You will learn the purpose of establishing a monitoring and evaluation system, and study the three main reasons why we monitor. You will study the 5 steps of establishing an M&E system, including how to determine a methodology and a source.

You will then study results and results-based management and frameworks, and look into outputs, outcomes, and goals. You will learn how to develop and select performance indicators, such as quantitative indicators, which show whether or not change and progress has been made. You will then study sources of information and methods of data collection. In addition, you will look into assumptions and risks and grouping indicators, and learn how to develop output monitoring tools.

Systematic and robust monitoring and evaluation depends on coherent program design. This course will give you a better understanding of how sound M&E systems are critical for helping organizations understand up to what extent they have inched towards their goal. By the end of this course, you will understand how to establish a monitoring and evaluation system. This is a powerful skill, so check out the course today and learn something really useful in just a few short hours.

  • The key points from this module are:
  • A Monitoring and Evaluation system is defined as a system for collecting and utilizing information on the progress of a project or programme. We collect and utilize this information with the overall goal of improving the project or programme. The purpose of establishing a Monitoring and Evaluation system is to have a structured framework in order to systematically plan what data is collected, when it is collected, how often it is collected, how it will be analysed and how it will be used to inform decision making. Monitoring and Evaluation also serves as a communication system to disseminate information both upwards and downwards to various stakeholders. 
  • The 10 Steps in Establishing Monitoring and Evaluation System include:
    1. What does Change look like?
    2. How to Know Change has happened
    3. How to Collect Data
    4. Articulating and Monitoring Risks and Assumptions
    5. Grouping indicators and Planning
    6. Developing Data Collection Tools
    7. Data Collection and Management
    8. Data Analysis 
    9. Interpreting and Reporting Findings 
    10. Learning and Using Findings
